titles.title: Gädlä Qirqos “Vita of Cyricus” / Täʾamrä Qirqos “Miracles of Cyricus” / Mälkәʾa Qirqos “Image of Cyricus” / Sälam-hymn for Cyricus

shortcontents.shortcontent:
I) Gädlä Qirqos “Vita of Cyricus” (fols. 4ra-22vb) II) Täʾamrä Qirqos “Miracles of Cyricus”: 16 Miracles (fols. 23ra-37ra) III) Mälkәʾa Qirqos “Image of Cyricus”: 42 strophes (fols. 37ra–42ra) IV) Sälam-hymn for Cyricus (fols. 42ra–42vb)
Colophons 1-2.

copyists.copyist: According to colophon 2, the scribe was priest (qes) Dästa Gäbrä Maryam of Lәgat.

donors.donor: Wäldä Yoḥannǝs, Wälättä Ṣadǝqan, Wäldä Maryam, Gäbrä Ḥawarya, Täwäldä Mädḫǝn, Gäbrä Mädḫǝn (colophon 1). Wälättä Ṣadǝqan according to colophon 2.

dcomments.dcomment: 27 Taḫśaś 1969 year of mercy (= 2 January 1976 A.D.), s. colophon 2.

bindings.binding: Two wooden boards covered with reddish-brown tooled leather. Two pairs of sewing stations.

bndecorations.bndecoration: Blind tooled ornament on the reddish-brown leather cover (at least 4 tools were used: triple line fillet, double circle, wave form, cross hatching).

bnothers.bnother: Two pairs of chains of endband stitches at the spine cover.

squires.squire: A(3/fols. 1r-3v) — I(8/fols. 4r-11v) — ፪II(8/fols. 12r-19v) — ፫III(8/fols. 20r-27v) — ፬IV(8; s.l.: 3, stub after 6; 6, stub after 3/fols. 28r-35v) — ፭V(8; s.l.: 3, stub after 6; 6, stub after 3/fols. 36r-43v) — B(2; s.l.: 1, stub after 1; 2, stub before 1/fols. 44r-45v)

taunit.ln-info: On average, 19 lines; on different folios, from 18 to 22 and 25 lines.
taunit.rl-info: Pricking and ruling are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks are visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

ppunctuations.ppunctuation: Executed: more or less regularly; Usage: not always logical. Dividers: I. Colon. II. - Four dot asterisk (esp. fols.: 4ra, l.18; 4rb, l.1; 14ra, l.1; 15ra, l.8; 23ra, l.18; 24va, l.6; 37ra, l.7; 37rb, l.10; 40ra, ls.14, 19; 41ra, l.16; 41va, ls.2, 3, 6, 13, 17, 19, 21; 41vb, l.12). - Nine dot asterisk (used throughout the text). III. Chain of black and red dots (esp. s.: the colophon, fol. 42rb; fol. 22vb, below the text).

rubrications.rubrication: The names of protagonists (Qirqos and ʾIyäluṭa); names of the donors. Groups of lines on the incipit page of Text I; two initial lines on the incipit page of Texts II and III; two initial lines of each miracle in Text II; incipit of each strophe in Text III. Elements of the punctuation signs, elements of Ethiopic numerals.

abbreviations.abbreviation: Fol. 42ra ls. 11, 15, 19, and fol. 42rb ls. 1, 6, 10: ሰላ፡ for ሰላም፡ Colophon II, Fol. 42rb: ለዓ፡ ዓ for ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡፡ and other abbreviated names

desccontent.mss: EMML no. 430 (1922/32), fols. 104r-112v: "Combat of St. Cyriacus [Gadla Qirqos]" (EMML II, 150; Church of the nativity, quarter of Lǝdäta, Addis Abäba). EMML no. 615 (1966), fols. 3r-42v: "Combat of St. Cyriacus [Gadla Qirqos]" (EMML II, 364; Church of St. Qirqos, quarter of Boleʾ, Addis Abäba). EMML no. 1934 (late 19th or early 20th cent.), fols. 29r-46r: "Martyrdom [gadl wa-semʿ] of Cyriacus and his Mother Julitta" (EMML V, 420; Monastery of Ḥayq Ǝsṭifanos, Ambassäl, Wallo). EMML no. 2514 (1382/88), fols. 126r-133r (in the "Gädlä Samaʿtat"): "Martyrdom of Cyriacus and his mother, Julitta" [Qirqos wa-emmu Iyyaluṭā] (EMML VII, 10; Church of Astit Kidana Mǝḥrät, Ankobärr, Shoa). EMML no. 3469 (19th cent.), fols. 2r-20r: "Martyrdom [Gadl wa-semʿ] of Cyriacus and his mother Julitta"; fols. 42r-61v: "Martyrdom [Gadl wa-samāʿt] of Cyriacus and his mother Julitta"; (EMML VIII, 283-284; Church of Šäwa Meda Qirqos, Gubbalafto, Yäğğu, Wallo). EMML no. 4816 (1951/2), fols. 15v-59r: "Text of the Martyrdom" (EMML X, 324; Church of Däse Mädḫane ʿAläm, Wallo). Éthiopien 134 (15th cent.), fol. 28: "Martyre de S. Cyr et sa mère Julitta et des onze mille trente-quatre autres martyrs qui suoffrirent du temps du Tribun Alexandre" (ZotBNat 202). Éthiopien 339 = Griaule 35 (1932), fols. 1ra-28vb: "Martyre de l'enfant Cyriaques (Qirqos) et sa mère Juliette (ʾIyalouṭâ)" (GrébGriaule II, 3-9). Orient. 686 (1755/69), fol. 128r (in "Acts of Saints and Martyrs"): "Quiricus, or Cyriacus, and Julitta, ቂርቆስ፡ ወእሙ፡ ኢየሉጣ፡ (16th of Ṭӗr)" (WrBriMus 167, no. 257). Orient. 687/688 (18th cent.), fol. 200r (in "Acts of Saints and Martyrs"): "Quiricus, or Cyriacus, and Julitta (15th of Ṭӗr)" (WrBriMus 169, no. 258). Orient. 692 (15th cent.), fol. 84r (in "Acts of Saints and Martyrs"): "Martyrdom of Quiricus, or Cyriacus, and Julitta, ቂርቆስ፡ ወእሙ፡ ኢየሉጣ፡ (15th of Ṭӗr)" (WrBriMus 165, no. 256). Orient. 720 (1775/76), fols. 1r-109v: "The acts of Quiricus, or Cyriacus, ቂርቆስ፡, and Julitta, ኢየሉጣ" (WrBriMus 194, no. 297) Ṭanasee 121 = Daga Ǝsṭifanos 10 (18th cent.), fols. 218r-227r ("Gädlä Samaʿtat"): "ቂርቆስ፡ und seine Mutter ኢየሉጣ፡" (SixTana III, 93, no. 10). Ṭanasee 177 = Daga Ǝsṭifanos 66 (14th/15th cent.), fols. 57ra-80vb "Vita und Zeugnis des hl. Kyriakos und seiner Mutter Julietta (äthiop.: Iyaluṭā)" (SixTana III, 235).

literature.text: BHG, 111-112. BHO, 193-195. BudSaint II, 1130-1131. ColSyn IX, 106-111. A. DILLMANN, “Über die apokryphen Märtyrergeschichten des Cyriacus mit Julitta und des Georgius”, Sitzungsberichte der königlich preussischen Akademie der Wissenschaften zu Berlin. 28. April. Sitzung der philosophisch-historischen Classe, Berlin 1887, 339-356. EAE IV, “Qirqos”. G. FIACCADORI, “Nuova iscrizione Greca da Aksum”, Parola del Passato Rivista di Studi Antichi (Fascicolo CCCLII [Estratto]), 62, Napoli 2007, 70-76. J. HABBI, “Ciriaco (Quiryaqos) e Giulietta (Yolete)”, EncSan, 491. T. ORLANDI, “Cyriacus and Julitta, Saints”, in: CE III, 671. E. SENGAL, “Poemetto amarico in onore di San Quirico”, Studi Etiopici raccolti da C. Conti Rossini, Roma 1954 (= RSE 4, 1944-1945 [1946]), 41-58.

desccontent.incipit: Fol. 4r: በስመ፡ አብ፡ ወወልድ፡ ወመንፈስ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ፩አምላክ፡ ገድል፡ ወስምዕ፡  ዘቅዱስ፡ ቂርቆስ፡ ወዘእሙ፡ ኢየሉጣ፡ ወዘካልአንኒ፡ ፼፲፻፵ወ፬ሰማዕታት፡ እለ፡  ተከለሉ፡ በመዋዕለ፡ እለ፡ እስክንድሮስ፡ መኰንን፨ ወኮነ፡ ስደት፡ ላዕለ፡ ኵሉ፡  አብያተ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ ዘክርስቶስ፡ ወኮነት፡ ብእሲት፡ እንተ፡ ስማ፡ ኢየሉጣ፡  ፈራሂተ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ እምንእሳ፨ ...
desccontent.itranslation: Fol. 4r: In the name of the Father and of the Son and of the Holy Spirit, one God, the life and the martyrdom of St. Cyricus  and of his mother Julitta and of other 11,034 martyrs who were crowned during the time when the governor (was) Alexander. And there was the persecution against all the families of the Christians of Christ (all the churches) and there was a woman whose name (was) Julitta who feared God from her infancy. ...
desccontent.explicit: Fol. 22va, l.6: ...ወከማሁ፡ ውእቱ፡ መምዓሊ፡ መኰንን፡ አዘዘ፡ ይዝርዉ፡ ሥጋሆሙ፨ ወመላእክተ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ የዓቅቡ፡ መለያልያቲሆሙ፡ ወኵሉ፡ አመ፡ ፲ወ፭ለሠርቀ፡ ጥር፨ ወሀሎ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ቂርቆስ፡ በየማነ፡ መንበሩ፡ ለእግዚአብሔር፡ ወትረ፡ ይቀውም፡ ወይተነብል፡ በእንተ፡ እለ፡ ይገብሩ፡ ኀበ፡እግዚአብሔር፡ ንጉ[fol. 22vb]ሠ፡ ስብሐት፡ ወክብር፡ ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜን፨
desccontent.etranslation: Fol. 22va, l. 6: ... And again, that tyrant, the governor ordered that they scatter their corpses. And the Angels of the Lord were protecting (all) their limbs, on the 15th of the month of Ṭərr. And St. Cyricus stands on the right side of the throne of God, and he is always present and he intercedes for those who make (his commemoration day), in front of the Lord, King of the glory and honour. For eternity, amen.

desccontent.text: II. Täʾamrä Qirqos “Miracles of Cyricus” (16 Miracles)
desccontent.mss: EMML no. 303 (20th cent.), fols. 87v-108r: "Miracles of St. Cyriacus" [Taʿamra Qirqos]"; (EMML II, 4; Church of St. Raphael, quarter of Guläle, Addis Abäba). EMML no. 615 (1966), fols. 43r-47r: "5 miracles of St. Cyriacus" (EMML II, 364; Church of Qirqos, quarter of Boleʾ, Addis Abäba). EMML no. 3469 (19th cent.), fols. 20r-26v: "Miracles of Cyriacus"; fols. 62r-69v: "Nine miracles of Cyriacus" (EMML VIII, 283-284; Church of Šäwa Meda Qirqos, Gubbalafto, Yağğu, Wallo). EMML no. 4816 (1951/2), fols. 59r-63r: "Miracles of Cyriacus" (EMML X, 324; Church of Däse Mädḫane ʿAläm, Wallo). Éthiopien 339 = Griaule 35 (1932), fols. 28vb-33vb: "Quatre miracles de l´enfant Cyriaque (Qirqos)" (GrébGriaule II, 3-9).

edition.text: S. GRÉBAUT, “Les miracles du saint enfant Cyriaque”, ROC 18 (1913), 419-423; 19 (1914), 93-97; 20 (1915-1917), 106-109, 129-132; 21 (1918-1919), 409-411; 25 (1925-1926), 187-195. S. GRÉBAUT, “Un nouveau recueil des miracles de l`enfant Cyriaque”, Aethiopica 3, 1935, 33-36, 85-91.

desccontent.itranslation: Fol. 23r: In the name of the Father and of the Son and of the Holy Spirit, one God, we start, with the help of the Lord, the beginning of the miracles of blessed Mar Cyricus. With the peace of the Lord, Father, amen. And there was a King, righteous and priest, whose name was Yəmrəḥannä Krəstos…
desccontent.explicit: Fol.37ra, l.3 (Miracle 16): …ወሞተ፡ በጊዜሃ፡ ወመንፈቆሙ፡ በከዩ፡ ወመንፈቆሙ፡ ተፈሥሑ፡ እሙንቱ፡ ስብእ፨ ጸሎቱ፡ ወበረከቱ፡ ወብድረ[sic]፡ ሩፀቱ፡ ምስለ፡ ፍቁራኒሁ፡ ወልደ፡ ዮሐንስ፡ ወለተ፡ ጻድቃን፡ ወልደ፡ ማርያም፡ ገብረ፡ ሐዋርያ፡ ተወልደ፡ መድኅን፡ ገብረ፡ መድኅን፡ ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜን፨
desccontent.etranslation: Fol. 37ra: And he died immediately and half of them, of those men, wept and half of them rejoiced. His prayer and his blessing and the race of his running (be) with his beloved Wäldä Yoḥannəs, Wälättä Ṣadqan, Wäldä Maryam, Gäbrä Ḥawarya, Täwäldä Mädḫən, Gäbrä Mädḫən, for eternity, amen. ...
desccontent.details:
II-1) Fols. 23ra (l. 8) – 24rb (l. 11): St. Cyricus and King Yəmrəḥannä Krəstos

(S. Grébaut, “Un nouveau recueil des miracles de l`enfant Cyriaque”, Aethiopica 3, 1935, 33-36 // mss. EMML no. 4816, fol. 59v, EMML X, 324; Éthiopien 339, fols. 28vb-30rb, GrébGriaule II, 4).

II-2) Fols. 24rb (l. 12) – 25ra (l. 19): St. Cyricus and St. George of Lydda.

II-3) Fols. 25rb (l. 1) – 26va (l. 11): St. Cyricus and the blind man who loved the fighting and the quarrel.

II-4) Fols. 26va (l. 12) – 27rb (l. 3): St. Cyricus and the infidel man.

II-5) Fols. 27rb (l. 4) – 27vb (l. 17): St. Cyricus and the guardian of the church of St. Cyriacus, in the region of May Ḍaˁada.

II-6) Fols. 27vb (l. 18) – 28vb (l. 15): St. Cyricus and the farmer who wanted to repair the tie-hook (qäraqəro) of the yoke.

II-7) Fols.  28vb (l. 16) – 30ra (l. 14): St. Cyricus and the evil man.

II-8) Fols. 30ra (l. 15) – 31ra (l. 15): St. Cyricus and the faithful men of  Qälma.

II-9) Fols. 31ra (l. 16) – 31vb (l. 2): St. Cyricus and the adulteress.

II-10) Fols. 31vb (l. 3) – 32rb (l. 7): St. Cyricus and the ruler who built other churches dedicated to him.

II-11) Fols. 32rb (l. 8) – 33ra (l. 4): St. Cyricus, learned priests of his church and a hermit.

II-12) Fols. 33ra (l. 5) – 33va (l. 17): St. Cyricus receiving his kidan on 15  Ṭərr.

II-13) Fols. 33va (l. 18) – 34rb (l. 19): St. Cyricus and the man of bad behavior.

II-14) Fols. 34va (l. 1) – 35ra (l. 16): St. Cyricus and St. Gäbrəˀel.

II-15) Fols. 35ra (l. 16) – 36ra (l. 8): St. Cyricus and the monk ˀElyas

(S. Grébaut, “Un noveau recueil des miracles de l`enfant Cyriaque”, Aethiopica 3, 1935, 87-90 // mss. EMML no. 3469, fol. 22r, EMML VIII, 283; EMML no. 4816, fol. 62v, EMML X, 324; Éthiopien 339, fols. 32vb-33vb, GrébGriaule II, 5).

II-16) Fols. 36ra (l. 9) – 37ra (l. 12): St. Cyricus and the thief who stole cloths and was punished.

(S. Grébaut, “Les miracles du saint enfant Cyriaque”, ROC 20 (1915-1917), 129-132 // ms. EMML no. 3469, fol. 25r, EMML VIII, 283).

desccontent.text: III. Mälkәʾa Qirqos “Images of Cyricus” (42 strophes)
desccontent.mss: EMML no. 486 (late 19th or early 20th, Church of Qirqos, quarter of Bole, ʾAddis ʾAbäba), fols. 49r-58v: “‘Imageʾ of St. Cyriacus [Malkeʾa Qirqos]”, (EMML II, 215).
desccontent.incipit: Fol. 37ra, l.14: ኦክርስቶስ፡ ናዝራዊ፡ ዘተወከፍከ፡ ሕማመ። ፀሐይ፡ ብሩህ፡ ወጽዱል፡ እስከ፡ ሡራሔሁ፡ አጽለመ፨ መጽሐፈ፡ ዜናሁ፡ ለቂርቆስ፡ መንፈሳዊ፡ ወዘመልክዑ፡ ሰላመ፨ ጸሐፍ፡ ውስተ፡ ልብየ፡ እንዘ፡ ትገብር፡ ቀለመ። ደመከ፡ አምላካዊ፡ በመስቀል፡ ዘዘንመ፨ …
desccontent.itranslation: Fol. 37ra, l.14: O Christ hermit, who have received the passion. Sun shining  and brilliant  so much so that His glory darkened. The book of the story of the spiritual Cyricus and of his image, salutation. Description in my hearth while you are making the color. Your divine blood which has rained by means of the Cross. …
desccontent.explicit: Fol. 41vb, l.18: …ኦአምላከ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ቂርቆስ፡ ወዘእሙ፡ ኢየሉጣ፡ ዕቀበነ፡ ወአድኅነነ፡ ሠውረነ፡ ወባልሐነ፡ እምኵሉ፡ ዘመነ፡ ም[fol. 42ra]ንሳዊ፡ ወእምዕለት፡ እኪት፡ ለሰብአ፡ ዛቲ፡ መቅደስ፨ ዐቢይ፡ ወንዑስ፨ ወፈድፋደስ፡ ለፍቁራኒከ፨ ወልደ፡ ዮሐንስ፡ ወብእሲቱ፡ ወለተ፡ ጻድቃን፡ ወወልዶሙ፡ ገብ[sic]፡ ጊዮርጊስ።
desccontent.etranslation: Fol. 41vb, l.18: …O God of saint Cyricus and of his mother Julitta, protect us and save us, hide us and liberate us from every moment of temptation and from the daily vice, the persons of this important and small sanctuary, and especially your beloved ones, Wäldä Yoḥannǝs and his wife Wälättä Ṣadǝqan and their son Gäbrä Giyorgis.

desccontent.mss: EMML no. 303 (20th cent., Church of St. Raphael, quarter of Guläle, ʾAddis ʾAbäba), fols. 108v-111r: “Greeting to St. Cyriacus [Salāmtā Za-Qirqos]”. (EMML II, 4). EMML no. 486 (late 19th or early 20th, Church of Qirqos, quarter of Boleʾ, ʾAddis ʾAbäba), fols. 59r-60v: “Greetings [salāmtāt] to St. Cyriacus and his mother Julitta [Iyaluṭṭa]” (EMML II, 215). EMML no. 3469 (19th cent., Church of Šäwa Meda Qirqos, Gubbalafto, Yäğğu, Wällo), fols. 35v-36r: “Greeting [Salām] to Cyriacus”, fol. 76r: “Greeting [Salām to Cyriacus]” (EMML VIII, 284). EMML no. 4816 (1951/2, Church of Däse Mädḫane ˤAläm, Wällo), fol. 63rv: "Greeting [Salām] to Cyriacus" (EMML X, 324;). Éthiopien 71 (18th cent.), fol. 3: "Salām à S. Cyriaque en dix neuf strophes" (ZotBNat 80). Éthiopien 381 (18th/19th cent.), fol. 43rb: "Salām à l’enfant Cyriaque; 5 strophes" (StrGriaule 13).
desccontent.incipit: Fol. 42ra, l.7: ሰላም፡ ለከ፡ ቂርቆስ፡ ሕፃን። መዓድመ፡ መልክዕ፡ ወስን፨ ዘኢያፍርሐከ፡ ትግርምተ፡ ዕልዋን፨ …
desccontent.itranslation: Fol. 42ra, l.7: Salutation to you, infant Cyricus. Pleasing of image and beauty,  whom the terror of the heretics does not terrified. ...
desccontent.etranslation: Fol. 42rb, l. 6: Salutation to you. Announce me, Cyricus, messanger (servant) of this my faith, time of my staying each hour before the son and his procreatress.  Salutation to you, valley of our peace, Cyricus who (are) so much as this river. Come, come, anytime, for the blessing and for the confession, so that you might remove the insanity from our people.

colophon.tran: Fol. 22vb: Herewith the life and the martyrdom of St. Cyricus and of his mother St. Julitta has been completed; may his prayer and his blessing be with his beloved Wäldä Yoḥannəs and his wife Wälättä Ṣadqan, Wäldä Maryam, Gäbrä Ḥawarya, Täwäldä Mädḫən, Gäbrä Mädḫən, for eternity. And for those who wrote it and for those who had it written, for those who read it and for those who translated it and for who listened it, its words, may he have mercy upon all of them, togheter, children of this sanctuary, and especially upon his beloved Gäbrä Giyorgis. For eternity, amen.

Fol. 42rb: This book is completed on the 27th of the month of Taḥśaś, in the year of mercy 1969; and Wälättä Ṣadqan, the wife of ˀato Bälay Bәrru, made it be written for 100 Bәrr, and gave it to the tabot of ˀUra Qirqos. And its scribe is the priest Dästa Gäbrä Maryam (from) Lәgat. May the one who stole it or erased (the text) be excommunicated with the authority of Peter and Paul. For eternity, amen and amen. Let it be, let it be.
colophon.det: The date mentioned is the year of mercy 1969 (= 2 January 1976 A.D.)

extras.extra: - The word ተአምር፡ "miracle" (with a short chain of black and red dots above it) is written in the upper margin of fol. 23r. - Crude notes in pen, sometimes hardly intelligible, are written in the upper margin: fols. 21r, 24r, 28r, 30r, 31r, 32v, 33r, 34v, 36r.

txquiremarks.txquiremark: - Decorated quire arks are written in the centre of the upper margin: fols. 12r: ፪, 20r: ፫, 28r: ፬, 36r: ፭.

frames.frame: - Fol. 4r: simple, coloured (red, white) ornamental band with two lateral and one central extensions reaching the bottom of the text; geometric motifs. - Fol. 23ra: two simple, coloured (red, white) ornamental bands separating Text I from Text II; geometric motifs. - Fol. 37ra: simple, coloured (red, white) ornamental band separating Text II from Text III; geometric motifs. - Fol. 42rb: simple, coloured (red, white) ornamental band, between the conclusion of Text IV and the colophon; geometric motifs.
